#+title: OU:M208:Unit-A1:Circles
#+filetags: OU M208 Mathematics Geometry Plane Circles

#+header: :width 350 :height 350 :units px
#+begin_src R :file ./assets/images/autogenerated/ou_m208_unit_1_circle.png :results output graphics file :exports result
library(ggplot2)
library(cowplot)
library(grid)
library(ggforce)

circle <-
  ggplot() +
  geom_circle(aes(x0 = 4, y0 = 4, r = 1)) +
  annotate("segment", x = 4, y = 4, xend = 4, yend = 5, colour = "green") +
  annotate("text", x = 4.2, y = 4.5, color = "green", label = "r") +
  geom_point(aes(x = 4, y = 4, color = "red")) +
  annotate("text", x = 3.8, y = 3.8, color = "red", label = "C(a, b)") +
  geom_point(aes(x = 4, y = 5, color = "black")) +
  annotate("text", x = 4.7, y = 5.2, color = "black", label = "P(x, y)") +
  theme(axis.line = element_line(color="black", arrow = arrow())) +
  coord_fixed() +
  xlab("x") +
  xlim(2, 6) +
  ylab("y") +
  ylim(2, 6) +
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(hjust = 1)) +
  theme(axis.title.y = element_text(hjust = 1)) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank()) +
  theme(axis.text.y = element_blank()) +
  theme(axis.ticks.x = element_blank()) +
  theme(axis.ticks.y = element_blank())

plot_grid(circle) + labs(caption = "A circle with radius r and centre (a, b)") + theme(plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "italic"))
#+end_src

#+RESULTS:
[[file:./assets/images/autogenerated/ou_m208_unit_1_circle.png]]

+ A Circle in \(\mathbb{R}^2\)is the set of points \(P(x, y)\) that
  lie at a fixed distance \(r\) , the *radius*, from a fixed point
  \(C(a, b)\), called the *centre*.

By the [[id:ff987959-8bd5-45b1-8f73-09637c52f1a8][distance formula]], every point \((x, y)\) on the circle with centre \((a, b)\)
and radius \(r\) satisfies

\begin{equation*}
\sqrt{(x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2} = r
\end{equation*}

By squaring the equation to remove the square root we get

#+LATEX_HEADER: \usepackage{tcolorbox}

\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Equation of a circle]
The equation of a circle in $\mathbb{R}^2$ with centre $(a, b)$ and radius $r$ is

\begin{equation*}
(x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2
\end{equation*}

\end{tcolorbox}
